lyrics.text: First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: What kind of race do the children compete in?
lyrics.translation: 孩子们参加的是什么样的比赛？

lyrics.text: The results have proved that children can be instructed in swimming at a very early age.
lyrics.translation: 结果证明，孩子们可以在非常小的年龄接受游泳指导。

lyrics.text: At a special swimming pool in Los Angeles, children become expert at holding their breath underwater even before they can walk.
lyrics.translation: 在洛杉矶一个特别的游泳池里，孩子们甚至在会走路之前就变得擅长在水下屏住呼吸。

lyrics.text: Babies of two months old do not appear to be reluctant to enter the water.
lyrics.translation: 两个月大的婴儿似乎并不抗拒进入水中。

lyrics.text: It is not long before they are so accustomed to swimming that they can pick up weights from the floor of the pool.
lyrics.translation: 不久，他们就习惯于游泳，以至于能够从泳池底部捡起重物。

lyrics.text: A game that is very popular with these young swimmers is the underwater tricycle race.
lyrics.translation: 一项在这些年轻游泳者中非常受欢迎的游戏是水下三轮车比赛。

lyrics.text: Tricycles are lined up on the floor of the pool seven feet underwater.
lyrics.translation: 三轮车排列在水下七英尺深的泳池地板上。

lyrics.text: The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool.
lyrics.translation: 孩子们相互竞争，以到达游泳池的另一端。

lyrics.text: Many pedal their tricycles, but most of them prefer to push or drag them.
lyrics.translation: 许多人踩着三轮车，但他们中的大多数人更喜欢推或拖它们。

lyrics.text: Some children can cover the whole length of the pool without coming up for breath even once.
lyrics.translation: 一些孩子可以在不换气的情况下游完整个泳池的长度。

lyrics.text: Whether they will ever become future Olympic champions, only time will tell.
lyrics.translation: 他们是否将成为未来的奥运冠军，只有时间能告诉我们。

lyrics.text: Meanwhile, they should encourage those among us who cannot swim five yards before they are gasping for air.
lyrics.translation: 同时，他们应该鼓励我们中那些游不到五码就会喘不过气来的人。
